intro: Pisonia platystemon, commonly known as the Hawaiian pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red-orange bracts that surround its small white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pisonia platystemon plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native birds and insects.
